Posts.Content: Hi there are 2 types of anaemia - iron deficiency for which you can eat iron rich foods and/or take iron supplements such as ferrous sulphate and pernicious anaemia - which is vitamin B12 deficiency , this is the one that your mum must have had as the treatment is an injection every 3 months of the wonderfully name hydroxicobalamin ! You have to have this by injection as it is destroyed by the stomach acids . Hope this helps xx
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Hi Jane , i'm going in on Wednesday for my mastectomy, like many others my cancer was found on a routine mammogram, at the moment i'm feeling quite calm and relaxed ( but the 2 glasses of wine) might account for that. I have to have a full mastectomy and axilla clearance as they found cells in 1 of my lymph nodes and i can't have a reconstruction till after i finish my treatments which will include cheom and hormone treatment and might include radiotherapy and herceptin , but i'm focusing on one thing at a time and reminding myself that everything that they do to me or give me id helping me fight this awful disease,and that i'm getting a free boob job at the end of it . i wil report back as soon as i can  so remember as David Cameron !! said ' we are all in this together '   keep  strong and take care xx Elaine
Posts.Title: My first post!

Posts.Content: hi all I am have the opposite issue to you in that I'm on my own without a partner which presents challanges of its own . for example today I haven't leaft the house and the only living creature i have spoken to since 4pm yesterday are my cats . I do have a daughter, sister, friends and an ex husband (on wife) who are supportive in their own way but 99% of the time i'm alone . I have been divorced for 15 years and I'm used to being alone but i some times think it would be lovely just to have some one to hold on to in the dark , but  know how aweful it is to have some one there who is the support you need ,when my father died of undiagnosised lung cancer my husband (as he was then ) was less than the tower of strengh that i needed. i don't know which is better to have a unsupportive partner or to have no partner at all , cos at least i don't have to fight any one for the remote control , but as every one says WE are here for you and we will always support you with love xxx

Posts.Title: your thoughts please-help should I have to ask or should it be offered...

Posts.Content: Hi Dawn I can understand your thinking but having a bilateral mastectomy if you can get your surgeon to agree is no guarantee that you won't have to have further treatment , the radiotherapy is done to make sure that any microscopic cancer cells that may have escaped are zapped and the hormone treatment such as Tamoxifen or Lentrazole are given to reduce or eliminate the chance of recurrence. The treatments aren't pleasant but all are doable . I had a full mastectomy , chemo,radio, herceptin (2 doses left) and I'm on Lentrazole for 5 years . You need to talk to your BC nurse about this and you will find loads of support on this site Elaine xxx
